greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Row sums of triangle A201201: first associated monic Laguerre polynomials with parameter alpha=1 evaluated at x=1.
formula: E.g.f. from A201201 with x=1, z->x: g(x)=(1+2*x)*exp(-1/(1+x))*(exp(1)-((Ei(1,-1/(1+x)) - Ei(1,-1))))/(1+x)^4 - x/(1+x)^3, with the exponential integral Ei. In order to obtain the series use first Ei(1,-y/(1+x)) - Ei(1,-y) and put y=1 afterwards.

This e.g.f. satisfies the homogeneous second-order differential equation: (1+x)^2*(d^2/dx^2)g(x) + (5+6*x)*(d/dx)g(x) + 6*g(x) = 0, with g(0)=1 and (d/dx)g(x)|_{x=0} = -3. This is equivalent to the recurrence conjectured by _R. J. Mathar_, which is thus proved.
mathematica: a[n_, k_] := (-1)^(n-k)*((n+1)*(n+1)!/((k+1)*(k+1)!))*Binomial[n, k]*HypergeometricPFQ[{-(n-k), k, 1}, {-(n+1), k+2}, 1]; Table[Sum[a[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 20}]  (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 21 2013 *)
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Dec 06 2011
